titleStmt.title: J. Donovan et al. to Thomas E. Bramlette
CWG5961

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Nov the 29 1864
Harrodsburg Mercer Ky
To the on Thomas. E Bramlet
Govener of Ky

wea The under siners are personal Aquanted with Sollomon Corn from his child hood up to this act he was all ways counted An onest young man on till this his First he confest his crime and give up The goos he tuck and was confind in The Mercer Jail and sent to frankfort Jail and sent back to Mecer and foung gilty and sent To The state prisen For Two years wea Think you will use your exative athority in his be behalf

J. Donovan
Jas Dana
Wiliam Vernon
Ja yost
B N Bauer
Cornelius Donovan
Markam Deringer
